pr_title: CAM-11531: add OpenAPI documentation for message endpoint

timeline.message:
fix(rest-openapi): add OpenAPI documentation for message endpoint

Related to CAM-11531

chore(rest-openapi): document optional response property

Related to CAM-11531

chore(rest-openapi): fix JSON formatting

Related to CAM-11531

chore(rest-openapi): use new dto macro

Related to CAM-11531

chore(rest-openapi): use new dto macro

Related to CAM-11531

timeline.bodyText: I think the documentation is wrong here. The implementation makes no validation for this statement. On the other hand, there is a validation that the tenantId and withoutTenantId parameters are mutually exclusive. I think that we need to move this statement to those two properties, as well as fix the docs.
timeline.author: koevskinikola
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,100 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "messageName"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "The name of the message to deliver."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "businessKey"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
+                Will only correlate to executions that belong to a process instance with the provided business key."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "tenantId"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "Used to correlate the message for a tenant with the given id.
+                Will only correlate to executions and process definitions which belong to the tenant."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "withoutTenantId"
+        type = "boolean"
+        defaultValue = 'false'
+        desc = "A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should only be correlated to executions
+                and process definitions which belong to no tenant or not. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
+                is the default behavior."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "processInstanceId"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "Used to correlate the message to the process instance with the given id.
+                Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `tenantId`."/>

timeline.bodyText:
To keep the id as close as possible to the Java method, this should be:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  id = "correlateMessage"
          
          
            
                  id = "deliverMessage"
timeline.author: koevskinikola

timeline.bodyText:
I think that this part: The property variablesInResultEnabled in the request body was false (Default). should go in the description property. summary should be short since it's put in a dropdown element in the UI.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                   "summary": "Status 200 Response. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `false` (Default).",
          
          
            
                                   "description": "The Response content of a status 200",
          
          
            
                                   "summary": "Status 200 Response.",
          
          
            
                                   "description": "The Response content of a status 200. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `false` (Default).",
timeline.author: koevskinikola

timeline.bodyText:
Same as above comment:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                 "summary": "Status 200 Response. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `true`.",
          
          
            
                                 "description": "The Response content of a status 200",
          
          
            
                                 "summary": "Status 200 Response.",
          
          
            
                                 "description": "The Response content of a status 200. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `true`.",
timeline.author: koevskinikola

timeline.bodyText:
We should also define the enum values here:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    type = "string"
          
          
            
                    type = "string"
          
          
            
                    enumValues = [ '"Execution"', '"ProcessDefinition"' ]
timeline.author: koevskinikola

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't this be of type ref?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    type = "object"
          
          
            
                    type = "ref"
timeline.author: koevskinikola
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "resultType"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "Indicates if the message was correlated to a message start event or an 
+                intermediate message catching event. In the first case, the resultType is 
+                `ProcessDefinition` and otherwise `Execution`."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "processInstance"
+        type = "object"

replies.bodyText: @yanavasileva, I'm not completely sure about this. Can you provide some input?
replies.author: koevskinikola

replies.bodyText: I will try to come to this later today
replies.author: yanavasileva
yanavasileva

replies.bodyText: and the ExecutionDto is missing or I am missing something?
replies.author: yanavasileva

replies.bodyText:
This means we can not use descriptions in these cases, right? I think this is a problem, beacause ref does not respect sibling elements. They are ignored.
https://swagger.io/docs/specification/using-ref/ ($ref and Sibling Elements)
replies.author: mboskamp

replies.bodyText:
yep, ref cannot have a description on this level, they can have inside the dto
this guy cannot be put here:

This property only has a value if the resultType is set to Execution
replies.author: yanavasileva

timeline.bodyText:
Same as above:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    type = "object"
          
          
            
                    type = "ref"
timeline.author: koevskinikola
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "resultType"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "Indicates if the message was correlated to a message start event or an 
+                intermediate message catching event. In the first case, the resultType is 
+                `ProcessDefinition` and otherwise `Execution`."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "processInstance"
+        type = "object"
+        dto = "ProcessInstanceDto"
+        desc = "This property only has a value if the resultType is set to `ProcessDefinition`. 
+                The processInstance with the properties as described in the
+                [get single instance](${docsUrl}/reference/rest/process-instance/get/) method."/>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "execution"
+        type = "object"
